forecast.name: Today
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy. High near 59, with temperatures falling to around 57 in the afternoon. South southeast wind 18 to 23 mph, with gusts as high as 39 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy, with a low around 55. South southeast wind around 20 mph, with gusts as high as 36 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between three quarters and one inch possible.

weather_report:
As dawn breaks over Downtown San Francisco, the city is shrouded in a heavy blanket of clouds, promising another day of rain. The air is thick with moisture; visibility is limited, giving the promise of a drizzly afternoon that will gradually soak the streets and parks. As temperatures hover around the mid-50s, the south southeast winds whip through the city, carrying with them gusts that dance eagerly through the fog. Although the Golden Gate Bridge stands as a sentinel, its beauty is dampened by the thick marine layer that cloaks its silhouette, while the distant hills are softened into an indistinct haze.

With an 80% chance of rain looming large today, it’s wise to dress in layers—think waterproof jackets and sturdy shoes that can withstand the dampness. While the vibrancy of the bustling streets may be muted in the wet chill, consider indulging in the cozy ambiance of a local café or exploring the warmth of museums downtown. As the rain patters against windowpanes, finding solace in a book or leisurely sipping a warming beverage can turn this gray day into a moment of delightful retreat from the world outside.
